results.title: La Gamberge = Nothing Venture, Nothing Have (Cinemascope Print)
results.brief_description:
Francoise is naive girl from the provinces whose dreams are very much influenced by frequent reading of magazines. When she meets Albert, a young parisian, she is so sure that he is her Prince Charming that she convinces him to take her back to Paris with him. Ten years later, she becomes the subject of a ‘tabloid’-style TV program to which Albert is invited.

Credits: Producer, Mag Bodard ; director, Norbert Carbonnaux ; writer, Francois Billetdoux ; photography, Pierre Petit ; music, Guy Beart.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Cassel, Francoise Dorleac, Arletty, Jean Poiret, Michel Serrault, Michel Vitold.

results.title: Medecin Malgre Lui
results.brief_description:
Argan, a hypochondriac who coughs constantly to impress upon his family and physicians the gravity of his condition. So concerned is Argan for his health that he resolves his daughter must marry a medical student, thereby ensuring he has a doctor near him at all times.

Credits: Director, Francois Gir ; photography, Robert Juillard ; music, Dominique Paladilhe.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Darras, Rosy Varte, Claude Nicot, G. Audoubert, Herve Sand, Dora Doll, Giani Esposito.

results.title: Le Diable Dans la Boite = the Devil in the Box
results.brief_description:
Satire about the expendability of personnel in a big contracting company challenged by the hunger strike of a young executive when he is fired with the vague reason of a re-structuring.

Credits: Producer, Mag Bodard ; director, Pierre Lary ; writers, Jean-Claude Carriere, Hugue Deboisieux, Pierre Lary ; photography, Sacha Vierny ; music, Jean-Claude Dequeant.
Cast: Jean Rochefort, Michel Lonsdale, Dominique Labourier, Anouk Ferjac, Micheline Presle.

results.title: Le Mur = the Wall
results.brief_description:
Three prisoners await execution by firing squad after their capture during the Spanish Civil War. Pablo is a loyalist jailed after he searched for his brother. An Irish mercenary and a Belgian physician are his cellmates. Flashbacks recall their lives before the war as they spend their last moments waiting for their date with death.

Credits: Producer, Claude Jaeger ; director, Serge Roullet ; writers, Jean-Paul Sartre, Serge Roullet ; photography, Denys Clerval ; music, Edgardo Canton ; assistant director, Benoit Jacquot.
Cast: Michel del castillo, Denis Maharrey, Matthieu Klossowski, Bernard Anglade, Rene Darmon, Jorge Lavelli, Peter Kassovitz.

results.title: French Cancan
results.brief_description:
Beautifully photographed, this comedy-drama chronicles the revival of Paris’ most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge. Renoir’s return to film-making in France after 15 years of absence is an exuberant and affectionate homage to the theatre of ‘La Belle Epoque’ (Edith Piaf and Patachou appear briefly as stars of the day.) It also gave him the opportunity to work with Gabin again, having made three films with him in the 1930s. According to Raymond Durgnat, Renoir’s can-can dancers “unleash the insolence not only of proletarian energy, but of the aggressive female, and storm the 19th century bourgeois male patriarchy… A river of feminine energy flows devastatingly, but not destructively, through society”.

Credits: Producer, Louis Wipf ; director, Jean Renoir ; writer, Jean Renoir ; photography, Michel Kelber ; music, Georges Van Parys ; art direction, Max Douy ; costumes, Rosine Delamare ; assistant director, Pierre Kast.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Francoise Arnoul, Maria Felix, Jean-Roger Caussimon, Gianni Esposito.

results.title: Sept Jours Ailleurs
results.brief_description:
A chronicle of the life of a young couple, doubling as a realistic portrait of urban and social conditions in France on the eve of May 68

Credits: Director, Marin Karmitz ; writers, Marin Karmitz, Catherine Martin ; photography, Sylvain du Pasquier ; music, Jacky Moreau ; choreography, Dirk Sanders.
Cast: Jacques Higelin, Vivianne Chiffre, Sonia Filatof, Vladanka Langofer, Yvonne Mestre, Fabienne Pradal, Christine Reynolds.

results.title: Une Cite Pas Comme les Autres
results.brief_description:
La Cite Universitaire de Paris’ is made up of 37 halls of residence, housing 5000 students, 70% of whom are international students. This documentary filmed in the 1970s details the philosophy of the Cite Universitaire through interviews with past and present managers as well as residents, including Senegal President L. Senghor and Henri, Prince of Denmark.

Credits: Director, Jean-Luc Magneron ; photography, Claude Mathe.

results.title: L'ecume des Jours = the Froth of Time
results.creator_credit: Charles Belmont, Andre Michelin and Philippe Senne
results.brief_description:
Colin, a rich and sentimental young man loves Chloe. His friend Chick shares his passion for literature and neglects his girlfriend Alise. Nicolas, driver and cook, is watching over this peaceful ‘world’. Colin’s life would be perfect, if only Chloe was not suffering from a mysterious disease.

Credits: Producers, Andre Michelin, Philippe Senne ; director, Charles Belmont ; writers, Charles belmont, Philippe Dumarcay, Pierre Pelegri ; photography, Jean-Jacques Rochut ; music, Andre Hodeir.
Cast: Jacques Perrin, Marie-France Pisier, Sami Frey, Alexandra Stewart, Annie Buron, Delphine Seyrig.

results.title: sentinelle endormie = The sleeping sentry (Cinemascope Print)
results.brief_description:
In 1812, in Chalons-sur-Marne, three doctors are plotting to assassinate emperor Napoleon. But when Doctor Mathieu realises that the assassination plan may involve killing innocent by-standers, his resolve starts to crumble.

Credits: Director, Jean Dreville ; writer, Noel-Noel ; photography, Pierre Petit ; music, Georges Auric.
Cast: Noel-Noel, Pascale Audret, Michel Galabru, Francis Blanche, Micheline Luccioni, Raymond Souplex.

results.title: Rue des Prairies = Meadows Street
results.creator_credit: Denys de la Patelliere and Alexandre Mnouchkine
results.brief_description:
At the end of World War II, Henri, returns from a POW camp to his three children. Life as a widowed father proves very challenging for Henri as the children seem to either get into trouble or turn against their father.

Credits: Producer, Alexandre Mnouchkine ; director, Denys de la Patelliere ; writer, Michel Audiard ; photography, Louis Page ; music, Georges van Parys.
Cast: Marie-Jose Nat, Jean Gabin, France Asselin, Roger Dumas, Claude Brasseur, Leon Zitrone.
